1â†’-- DevFlow Foundation Database Schema
     2â†’-- SQLite with JSON1, FTS5, and Vector extensions
     3â†’-- Version: 1.0.0
     4â†’
     5â†’PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;
     6â†’PRAGMA journal_mode = WAL;
     7â†’PRAGMA synchronous = NORMAL;
     8â†’PRAGMA cache_size = -64000; -- 64MB cache
     9â†’PRAGMA temp_store = memory;
    10â†’
    11â†’-- ============================================================================
    12â†’-- CORE MEMORY SYSTEM TABLES
    13â†’-- ============================================================================
    14â†’
    15â†’-- Task contexts - Central registry for all development tasks
    16â†’CREATE TABLE task_contexts (
    17â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
    18â†’    title TEXT NOT NULL,
    19â†’    description TEXT,
    20â†’    priority TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'm-' CHECK(priority IN ('h-', 'm-', 'l-', '?-')),
    21â†’    status TEXT DEFAULT 'planning' CHECK(status IN ('planning', 'active', 'blocked', 'completed', 'archived')),
    22â†’    
    23â†’    -- AI-powered task analysis
    24â†’    complexity_score REAL CHECK(complexity_score BETWEEN 0.0 AND 1.0),
    25â†’    estimated_duration_minutes INTEGER,
    26â†’    required_capabilities TEXT, -- JSON array of capability domains
    27â†’    
    28â†’    -- Platform routing intelligence
    29â†’    primary_platform TEXT CHECK(primary_platform IN ('claude_code', 'openai_codex', 'gemini_cli', 'cursor')),
    30â†’    platform_routing TEXT, -- JSON object with platform scores and preferences
    31â†’    
    32â†’    -- Specialized memory contexts (JSON objects optimized per platform)
    33â†’    architectural_context TEXT DEFAULT '{}', -- For Claude Code architectural decisions
    34â†’    implementation_context TEXT DEFAULT '{}', -- For OpenAI Codex implementation patterns  
    35â†’    debugging_context TEXT DEFAULT '{}', -- For Gemini CLI debugging workflows
    36â†’    maintenance_context TEXT DEFAULT '{}', -- For Cursor maintenance tasks
    37â†’    
    38â†’    -- cc-sessions integration
    39â†’    cc_session_id TEXT,
    40â†’    cc_task_file TEXT, -- Path to sessions/tasks/ file
    41â†’    branch_name TEXT,
    42â†’    
    43â†’    -- Task relationships
    44â†’    parent_task_id TEXT REFERENCES task_contexts(id),
    45â†’    depends_on TEXT, -- JSON array of task IDs this depends on
    46â†’    
    47â†’    -- Metadata and lifecycle
    48â†’    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
    49â†’    updated_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
    50â†’    completed_at TEXT,
    51â†’    
    52â†’    -- Indexes
    53â†’    INDEX idx_task_status (status),
    54â†’    INDEX idx_task_priority (priority),
    55â†’    INDEX idx_task_platform (primary_platform),
    56â†’    INDEX idx_task_complexity (complexity_score),
    57â†’    INDEX idx_task_created (created_at),
    58â†’    INDEX idx_task_cc_session (cc_session_id)
    59â†’);
    60â†’
    61â†’-- Memory blocks - Structured persistent memory with semantic capabilities
    62â†’CREATE TABLE memory_blocks (
    63â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
    64â†’    task_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES task_contexts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    65â†’    session_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    66â†’    
    67â†’    -- Block classification
    68â†’    block_type TEXT NOT NULL CHECK(block_type IN ('architectural', 'implementation', 'debugging', 'maintenance', 'context', 'decision')),
    69â†’    label TEXT NOT NULL, -- Human-readable identifier
    70â†’    content TEXT NOT NULL,
    71â†’    
    72â†’    -- Metadata and relationships
    73â†’    metadata TEXT DEFAULT '{}', -- JSON with platform, tools_used, file_paths, etc.
    74â†’    importance_score REAL DEFAULT 0.5 CHECK(importance_score BETWEEN 0.0 AND 1.0),
    75â†’    relationships TEXT DEFAULT '[]', -- JSON array of related block IDs
    76â†’    
    77â†’    -- Semantic search capability
    78â†’    embedding BLOB, -- Vector embeddings for semantic similarity search
    79â†’    embedding_model TEXT DEFAULT 'text-embedding-3-small',
    80â†’    
    81â†’    -- Lifecycle tracking
    82â†’    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
    83â†’    last_accessed TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
    84â†’    access_count INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
    85â†’    
    86â†’    -- Indexes for performance
    87â†’    INDEX idx_memory_task (task_id),
    88â†’    INDEX idx_memory_session (session_id),
    89â†’    INDEX idx_memory_type (block_type),
    90â†’    INDEX idx_memory_importance (importance_score DESC),
    91â†’    INDEX idx_memory_created (created_at),
    92â†’    INDEX idx_memory_accessed (last_accessed DESC)
    93â†’);
    94â†’
    95â†’-- Coordination sessions - Track cross-platform AI interactions
    96â†’CREATE TABLE coordination_sessions (
    97â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
    98â†’    task_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES task_contexts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    99â†’    platform TEXT NOT NULL CHECK(platform IN ('claude_code', 'openai_codex', 'gemini_cli', 'cursor', 'openrouter')),
   100â†’    session_type TEXT DEFAULT 'development' CHECK(session_type IN ('development', 'review', 'debugging', 'handoff', 'planning')),
   101â†’    
   102â†’    -- Session lifecycle
   103â†’    start_time TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   104â†’    end_time TEXT,
   105â†’    duration_seconds INTEGER GENERATED ALWAYS AS (
   106â†’        CASE 
   107â†’            WHEN end_time IS NOT NULL 
   108â†’            THEN (julianday(end_time) - julianday(start_time)) * 86400
   109â†’            ELSE NULL 
   110â†’        END
   111â†’    ) STORED,
   112â†’    
   113â†’    -- Resource tracking and optimization
   114â†’    tokens_used INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   115â†’    api_calls INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   116â†’    estimated_cost_usd REAL DEFAULT 0.0,
   117â†’    model_used TEXT, -- Which specific model was used
   118â†’    
   119â†’    -- Context management metrics
   120â†’    context_size_start INTEGER, -- Context size at session start (chars/tokens)
   121â†’    context_size_end INTEGER, -- Context size at session end
   122â†’    compaction_events INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- How many times context was compacted
   123â†’    
   124â†’    -- Cross-platform handoff tracking
   125â†’    handoff_from_session TEXT REFERENCES coordination_sessions(id),
   126â†’    handoff_to_session TEXT REFERENCES coordination_sessions(id),
   127â†’    handoff_context TEXT, -- JSON object with handoff data
   128â†’    handoff_success BOOLEAN,
   129â†’    
   130â†’    -- Performance and satisfaction metrics
   131â†’    user_satisfaction INTEGER CHECK(user_satisfaction BETWEEN 1 AND 5),
   132â†’    task_progress_delta REAL DEFAULT 0.0 CHECK(task_progress_delta BETWEEN -1.0 AND 1.0),
   133â†’    errors_encountered INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   134â†’    
   135â†’    -- Session metadata
   136â†’    metadata TEXT DEFAULT '{}', -- JSON for session-specific data
   137â†’    
   138â†’    -- Indexes
   139â†’    INDEX idx_session_task (task_id),
   140â†’    INDEX idx_session_platform (platform),
   141â†’    INDEX idx_session_time (start_time, end_time),
   142â†’    INDEX idx_session_cost (estimated_cost_usd),
   143â†’    INDEX idx_session_handoff_from (handoff_from_session),
   144â†’    INDEX idx_session_handoff_to (handoff_to_session)
   145â†’);
   146â†’
   147â†’-- ============================================================================
   148â†’-- PERFORMANCE AND ANALYTICS TABLES
   149â†’-- ============================================================================
   150â†’
   151â†’-- Platform performance tracking - Learn from usage patterns
   152â†’CREATE TABLE platform_performance (
   153â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
   154â†’    platform TEXT NOT NULL,
   155â†’    capability_domain TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'architecture', 'implementation', etc.
   156â†’    task_type TEXT NOT NULL,
   157â†’    
   158â†’    -- Performance metrics (updated periodically)
   159â†’    success_rate REAL DEFAULT 0.0 CHECK(success_rate BETWEEN 0.0 AND 1.0),
   160â†’    average_duration_seconds REAL,
   161â†’    average_token_usage INTEGER,
   162â†’    average_cost_usd REAL,
   163â†’    user_satisfaction_avg REAL CHECK(user_satisfaction_avg BETWEEN 1.0 AND 5.0),
   164â†’    
   165â†’    -- Statistical confidence
   166â†’    total_tasks INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   167â†’    measurement_period_start TEXT,
   168â†’    measurement_period_end TEXT,
   169â†’    confidence_score REAL DEFAULT 0.0 CHECK(confidence_score BETWEEN 0.0 AND 1.0),
   170â†’    
   171â†’    -- Metadata
   172â†’    last_updated TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   173â†’    
   174â†’    UNIQUE(platform, capability_domain, task_type, measurement_period_start)
   175â†’);
   176â†’
   177â†’-- Cost tracking and optimization
   178â†’CREATE TABLE cost_analytics (
   179â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
   180â†’    date TEXT NOT NULL, -- YYYY-MM-DD format
   181â†’    platform TEXT NOT NULL,
   182â†’    model TEXT NOT NULL,
   183â†’    
   184â†’    -- Daily aggregated costs
   185â†’    total_requests INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   186â†’    total_tokens INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   187â†’    total_cost_usd REAL DEFAULT 0.0,
   188â†’    
   189â†’    -- Token breakdown
   190â†’    input_tokens INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   191â†’    output_tokens INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   192â†’    
   193â†’    -- Efficiency metrics
   194â†’    average_tokens_per_request REAL,
   195â†’    cost_per_token REAL,
   196â†’    tasks_completed INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   197â†’    cost_per_task REAL,
   198â†’    
   199â†’    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   200â†’    
   201â†’    UNIQUE(date, platform, model),
   202â†’    INDEX idx_cost_date (date),
   203â†’    INDEX idx_cost_platform (platform),
   204â†’    INDEX idx_cost_total (total_cost_usd DESC)
   205â†’);
   206â†’
   207â†’-- ============================================================================
   208â†’-- KNOWLEDGE ENTITIES AND RELATIONSHIPS
   209â†’-- ============================================================================
   210â†’
   211â†’-- Knowledge entities - Long-term learning from development patterns
   212â†’CREATE TABLE knowledge_entities (
   213â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
   214â†’    entity_type TEXT NOT NULL CHECK(entity_type IN ('person', 'technology', 'pattern', 'antipattern', 'rule', 'preference')),
   215â†’    name TEXT NOT NULL,
   216â†’    description TEXT,
   217â†’    confidence_score REAL DEFAULT 0.5 CHECK(confidence_score BETWEEN 0.0 AND 1.0),
   218â†’    
   219â†’    -- Source attribution
   220â†’    extraction_source TEXT NOT NULL, -- JSON with source session, task, etc.
   221â†’    learned_from_task_id TEXT REFERENCES task_contexts(id),
   222â†’    
   223â†’    -- Lifecycle and validation
   224â†’    first_seen TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   225â†’    last_confirmed TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   226â†’    usage_count INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   227â†’    validation_status TEXT DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(validation_status IN ('pending', 'confirmed', 'rejected')),
   228â†’    
   229â†’    -- Search optimization  
   230â†’    embedding BLOB, -- Vector embeddings for semantic search
   231â†’    tags TEXT DEFAULT '[]', -- JSON array of searchable tags
   232â†’    
   233â†’    UNIQUE(entity_type, name),
   234â†’    INDEX idx_entity_type (entity_type),
   235â†’    INDEX idx_entity_confidence (confidence_score DESC),
   236â†’    INDEX idx_entity_usage (usage_count DESC)
   237â†’);
   238â†’
   239â†’-- Entity relationships - Capture knowledge graph connections
   240â†’CREATE TABLE entity_relationships (
   241â†’    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT (lower(hex(randomblob(16)))),
   242â†’    source_entity_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES knowledge_entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   243â†’    target_entity_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES knowledge_entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   244â†’    relationship_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'depends_on', 'conflicts_with', 'enhances', etc.
   245â†’    relationship_strength REAL DEFAULT 0.5 CHECK(relationship_strength BETWEEN 0.0 AND 1.0),
   246â†’    context_description TEXT,
   247â†’    
   248â†’    -- Lifecycle tracking
   249â†’    discovered_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   250â†’    confirmed_count INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   251â†’    last_confirmed TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   252â†’    
   253â†’    UNIQUE(source_entity_id, target_entity_id, relationship_type),
   254â†’    INDEX idx_relationship_source (source_entity_id),
   255â†’    INDEX idx_relationship_target (target_entity_id),
   256â†’    INDEX idx_relationship_strength (relationship_strength DESC)
   257â†’);
   258â†’
   259â†’-- ============================================================================
   260â†’-- FULL-TEXT SEARCH AND SEMANTIC CAPABILITIES
   261â†’-- ============================================================================
   262â†’
   263â†’-- Full-text search for memory blocks
   264â†’CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE memory_fts USING fts5(
   265â†’    content,
   266â†’    label, 
   267â†’    block_type,
   268â†’    content='memory_blocks',
   269â†’    content_rowid='rowid',
   270â†’    tokenize='porter ascii'
   271â†’);
   272â†’
   273â†’-- Full-text search for task contexts
   274â†’CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE tasks_fts USING fts5(
   275â†’    title,
   276â†’    description,
   277â†’    content='task_contexts', 
   278â†’    content_rowid='rowid',
   279â†’    tokenize='porter ascii'
   280â†’);
   281â†’
   282â†’-- ============================================================================
   283â†’-- TRIGGERS FOR AUTOMATIC MAINTENANCE
   284â†’-- ============================================================================
   285â†’
   286â†’-- Update task contexts timestamp on modification
   287â†’CREATE TRIGGER update_task_contexts_timestamp 
   288â†’    AFTER UPDATE ON task_contexts
   289â†’BEGIN
   290â†’    UPDATE task_contexts SET updated_at = datetime('now', 'utc') WHERE id = NEW.id;
   291â†’END;
   292â†’
   293â†’-- Update memory block access tracking
   294â†’CREATE TRIGGER update_memory_access 
   295â†’    AFTER UPDATE ON memory_blocks
   296â†’    WHEN OLD.content = NEW.content -- Only update access time, not modification
   297â†’BEGIN
   298â†’    UPDATE memory_blocks SET 
   299â†’        last_accessed = datetime('now', 'utc'),
   300â†’        access_count = access_count + 1 
   301â†’    WHERE id = NEW.id;
   302â†’END;
   303â†’
   304â†’-- Maintain FTS indexes automatically
   305â†’CREATE TRIGGER memory_fts_insert AFTER INSERT ON memory_blocks BEGIN
   306â†’    INSERT INTO memory_fts(rowid, content, label, block_type) 
   307â†’    VALUES (NEW.rowid, NEW.content, NEW.label, NEW.block_type);
   308â†’END;
   309â†’
   310â†’CREATE TRIGGER memory_fts_delete AFTER DELETE ON memory_blocks BEGIN
   311â†’    INSERT INTO memory_fts(memory_fts, rowid, content, label, block_type) 
   312â†’    VALUES ('delete', OLD.rowid, OLD.content, OLD.label, OLD.block_type);
   313â†’END;
   314â†’
   315â†’CREATE TRIGGER memory_fts_update AFTER UPDATE ON memory_blocks BEGIN
   316â†’    INSERT INTO memory_fts(memory_fts, rowid, content, label, block_type) 
   317â†’    VALUES ('delete', OLD.rowid, OLD.content, OLD.label, OLD.block_type);
   318â†’    INSERT INTO memory_fts(rowid, content, label, block_type) 
   319â†’    VALUES (NEW.rowid, NEW.content, NEW.label, NEW.block_type);
   320â†’END;
   321â†’
   322â†’-- Similar triggers for tasks FTS
   323â†’CREATE TRIGGER tasks_fts_insert AFTER INSERT ON task_contexts BEGIN
   324â†’    INSERT INTO tasks_fts(rowid, title, description) 
   325â†’    VALUES (NEW.rowid, NEW.title, COALESCE(NEW.description, ''));
   326â†’END;
   327â†’
   328â†’CREATE TRIGGER tasks_fts_delete AFTER DELETE ON task_contexts BEGIN
   329â†’    INSERT INTO tasks_fts(tasks_fts, rowid, title, description) 
   330â†’    VALUES ('delete', OLD.rowid, OLD.title, COALESCE(OLD.description, ''));
   331â†’END;
   332â†’
   333â†’CREATE TRIGGER tasks_fts_update AFTER UPDATE ON task_contexts BEGIN
   334â†’    INSERT INTO tasks_fts(tasks_fts, rowid, title, description) 
   335â†’    VALUES ('delete', OLD.rowid, OLD.title, COALESCE(OLD.description, ''));
   336â†’    INSERT INTO tasks_fts(rowid, title, description) 
   337â†’    VALUES (NEW.rowid, NEW.title, COALESCE(NEW.description, ''));
   338â†’END;
   339â†’
   340â†’-- ============================================================================
   341â†’-- VIEWS FOR COMMON QUERIES
   342â†’-- ============================================================================
   343â†’
   344â†’-- Active tasks with latest session info
   345â†’CREATE VIEW active_tasks_with_sessions AS
   346â†’SELECT 
   347â†’    tc.id,
   348â†’    tc.title,
   349â†’    tc.priority,
   350â†’    tc.status,
   351â†’    tc.primary_platform,
   352â†’    tc.complexity_score,
   353â†’    cs.id as latest_session_id,
   354â†’    cs.platform as current_platform,
   355â†’    cs.start_time as session_start,
   356â†’    cs.tokens_used,
   357â†’    cs.estimated_cost_usd,
   358â†’    COUNT(mb.id) as memory_blocks_count
   359â†’FROM task_contexts tc
   360â†’LEFT JOIN coordination_sessions cs ON tc.id = cs.task_id 
   361â†’    AND cs.start_time = (
   362â†’        SELECT MAX(start_time) 
   363â†’        FROM coordination_sessions 
   364â†’        WHERE task_id = tc.id
   365â†’    )
   366â†’LEFT JOIN memory_blocks mb ON tc.id = mb.task_id
   367â†’WHERE tc.status IN ('active', 'planning')
   368â†’GROUP BY tc.id, cs.id
   369â†’ORDER BY tc.priority DESC, tc.updated_at DESC;
   370â†’
   371â†’-- Platform performance summary
   372â†’CREATE VIEW platform_efficiency_summary AS
   373â†’SELECT 
   374â†’    platform,
   375â†’    COUNT(*) as total_sessions,
   376â†’    AVG(duration_seconds) as avg_duration,
   377â†’    AVG(tokens_used) as avg_tokens,
   378â†’    AVG(estimated_cost_usd) as avg_cost,
   379â†’    AVG(CASE WHEN user_satisfaction IS NOT NULL THEN user_satisfaction END) as avg_satisfaction,
   380â†’    SUM(estimated_cost_usd) as total_cost,
   381â†’    COUNT(CASE WHEN handoff_success = 1 THEN 1 END) as successful_handoffs,
   382â†’    COUNT(CASE WHEN handoff_from_session IS NOT NULL THEN 1 END) as total_handoffs
   383â†’FROM coordination_sessions
   384â†’WHERE end_time IS NOT NULL
   385â†’GROUP BY platform
   386â†’ORDER BY avg_satisfaction DESC, avg_cost ASC;
   387â†’
   388â†’-- ============================================================================
   389â†’-- INITIAL CONFIGURATION DATA
   390â†’-- ============================================================================
   391â†’
   392â†’-- Insert default platform capabilities
   393â†’INSERT INTO platform_performance (platform, capability_domain, task_type, confidence_score, total_tasks, measurement_period_start) VALUES
   394â†’-- Claude Code specializations
   395â†’('claude_code', 'architecture', 'system_design', 0.9, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   396â†’('claude_code', 'architecture', 'code_review', 0.85, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   397â†’('claude_code', 'architecture', 'documentation', 0.8, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   398â†’
   399â†’-- OpenAI Codex specializations  
   400â†’('openai_codex', 'implementation', 'bulk_coding', 0.9, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   401â†’('openai_codex', 'implementation', 'pattern_following', 0.85, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   402â†’('openai_codex', 'implementation', 'api_integration', 0.8, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   403â†’
   404â†’-- Gemini CLI specializations
   405â†’('gemini_cli', 'debugging', 'error_analysis', 0.9, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   406â†’('gemini_cli', 'debugging', 'systematic_testing', 0.85, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   407â†’('gemini_cli', 'debugging', 'performance_optimization', 0.8, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   408â†’
   409â†’-- Cursor specializations
   410â†’('cursor', 'maintenance', 'codebase_navigation', 0.9, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   411â†’('cursor', 'maintenance', 'refactoring', 0.8, 0, datetime('now', 'utc')),
   412â†’('cursor', 'maintenance', 'documentation_sync', 0.85, 0, datetime('now', 'utc'));
   413â†’
   414â†’-- Create schema version tracking
   415â†’CREATE TABLE schema_versions (
   416â†’    version TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
   417â†’    applied_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now', 'utc')),
   418â†’    description TEXT
   419â†’);
   420â†’
   421â†’INSERT INTO schema_versions (version, description) VALUES 
   422â†’('1.0.0', 'Initial DevFlow Foundation schema with memory blocks, task contexts, and coordination sessions');
   423â†’
   424â†’-- Performance optimization
   425â†’ANALYZE;

1â†’# DevFlow Phase 2 - Advanced Intelligence Implementation
     2â†’## Sprint 4.1: Semantic Search Engine Foundation
     3â†’
     4â†’**Created**: 2025-09-09  
     5â†’**Status**: Planning  
     6â†’**Sprint Duration**: 7 days  
     7â†’**Phase**: Advanced Intelligence (Phase 2)
     8â†’
     9â†’---
    10â†’
    11â†’## ğŸ¯ Sprint Objective
    12â†’
    13â†’Implementare **Hybrid Semantic Search Engine** che combina FTS5 keyword search con vector similarity per DevFlow memory system, abilitando ricerca semantica avanzata nei MemoryBlocks e KnowledgeEntities.
    14â†’
    15â†’---
    16â†’
    17â†’## ğŸ“‹ Sprint Backlog
    18â†’
    19â†’### **DEVFLOW-P2-SEARCH-002: Semantic Search Engine**
    20â†’**Priority**: Critical - Foundation per Advanced Intelligence  
    21â†’**Dependencies**: DEVFLOW-P2-VECTOR-001 (VectorEmbeddingService) âœ… COMPLETATO
    22â†’
    23â†’#### **Subtasks Breakdown**:
    24â†’
    25â†’1. **DEVFLOW-P2-SEARCH-DESIGN-002A** - Architecture Design
    26â†’   - **Owner**: Claude Code (Architect)
    27â†’   - **Duration**: 1-2 giorni
    28â†’   - **Deliverables**: API contract, integration specs, performance requirements
    29â†’
    30â†’2. **DEVFLOW-P2-SEARCH-ALGO-002B** - Algorithm Design  
    31â†’   - **Owner**: Synthetic_Reasoning (DeepSeek-V3)
    32â†’   - **Duration**: 1 giorno
    33â†’   - **Deliverables**: Hybrid ranking algorithm, weighting strategies
    34â†’
    35â†’3. **DEVFLOW-P2-SEARCH-SERVICE-002C** - Core Service Implementation
    36â†’   - **Owner**: Synthetic_Code (Qwen3-Coder-480B)
    37â†’   - **Duration**: 2 giorni  
    38â†’   - **Deliverables**: SemanticSearchService, hybrid search logic
    39â†’
    40â†’4. **DEVFLOW-P2-SEARCH-INDEXING-002D** - Real-time Indexing

## Context Manifest

### How the Current Memory and Search System Works

DevFlow's memory architecture is built on a 4-layer system centered around the SQLiteMemoryManager that coordinates persistent memory storage, search capabilities, and cross-platform AI interactions. Understanding this system is crucial for implementing the hybrid semantic search engine.

**Memory Block Storage and Lifecycle:**
When a memory block is created, the process starts in SQLiteMemoryManager.storeMemoryBlock(), which delegates to BlockService.create(). The BlockService generates a unique ID using `lower(hex(randomblob(16)))` and inserts the block into the `memory_blocks` table with comprehensive metadata including task_id, session_id, block_type (architectural/implementation/debugging/maintenance/context/decision), content, importance_score, and relationships array. The database schema enforces referential integrity with task_contexts and includes extensive indexing for performance on task_id, session_id, block_type, importance_score, created_at, and last_accessed fields.

**Current FTS5 Search Implementation:**
The existing search system uses SQLite's FTS5 extension through the SearchService class. When memory blocks are created, database triggers automatically populate the `memory_fts` virtual table with content, label, and block_type fields using Porter stemming and ASCII tokenization. The current SearchService.fullText() method queries using `SELECT mb.* FROM memory_fts f JOIN memory_blocks mb ON mb.rowid = f.rowid WHERE memory_fts MATCH ? ORDER BY mb.rowid DESC LIMIT ?`, which provides BM25-based ranking but lacks semantic understanding. The search results are materialized into full MemoryBlock objects with JSON parsing for metadata and relationships.

**VectorEmbeddingService Integration Foundation:**
The VectorEmbeddingService, already implemented as DEVFLOW-P2-VECTOR-001, provides comprehensive multi-model vector embedding capabilities with OpenAI's text-embedding-3-small (1536 dimensions) and text-embedding-3-large (3072 dimensions) as primary providers. The service maintains its own database tables: `memory_block_embeddings` and `knowledge_entity_embeddings`, both storing embeddings as BLOBs alongside model metadata and timestamps. The service includes sophisticated caching (24-hour TTL), batch processing capabilities, and cosine similarity calculation methods. Critically, the VectorEmbeddingService.findSimilarMemoryBlocks() method already performs semantic search by joining memory_blocks with memory_block_embeddings and filtering on similarity thresholds, but it operates independently from the FTS5 system.

**Database Schema Architecture:**
The schema.sql defines a sophisticated structure with memory_blocks as the core table containing embedding BLOB fields and embedding_model TEXT fields for vector storage. The memory_fts virtual table provides FTS5 capabilities with automatic triggers maintaining synchronization. The schema includes indexes optimized for both traditional queries (task_id, session_id, block_type) and will support hybrid search patterns. The database uses WAL mode, 64MB cache, and PRAGMA optimizations for performance.

**Current SearchService Limitations:**
The SearchService.semantic() method is currently a placeholder that simply runs FTS5 queries and returns hardcoded similarity scores of 0.5, demonstrating the gap that needs to be filled. The method structure shows the expected return type (SemanticSearchResult[]) but lacks actual semantic understanding or vector similarity calculations.

### For New Hybrid Search Implementation

The hybrid semantic search engine must bridge the existing FTS5 keyword search with the VectorEmbeddingService's semantic capabilities while maintaining backward compatibility and achieving the <200ms performance target.

**Integration Architecture Requirements:**
The new SemanticSearchService must integrate with both the existing SearchService (for FTS5 queries) and VectorEmbeddingService (for vector similarity). The SQLiteMemoryManager.semanticSearch() method currently delegates to SearchService.semantic(), so the implementation should either enhance SearchService or replace this delegation path. The hybrid approach requires combining FTS5 BM25 scores with cosine similarity scores using configurable weighting algorithms.

**Real-time Indexing Integration:**
Memory block creation currently triggers FTS5 indexing through database triggers, but vector embedding generation is not automatically triggered. The new system must extend the BlockService.create() workflow to automatically generate embeddings via VectorEmbeddingService when blocks are created. This requires careful transaction management to ensure atomicity and error handling if embedding generation fails.

**Performance Considerations:**
FTS5 queries are fast (typically <10ms for the current dataset) but vector similarity searches require loading and comparing embeddings from BLOBs, which can be expensive. The VectorEmbeddingService already implements caching for embedding generation, but the hybrid system will need result caching and query optimization strategies. The target <200ms response time requires efficient query planning, possibly including similarity threshold filtering before expensive operations.

**Backward Compatibility Requirements:**
All existing FTS5 functionality must remain unchanged - this means the current SearchService.fullText() method and memory_fts triggers must continue working exactly as before. The hybrid system should enhance rather than replace the existing search capabilities, providing new methods while preserving all current APIs.

cosineSimilarity(a: Float32Array, b: Float32Array): number
```

```

  return this.searchSvc.semantic(query, options);
